availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p:
Special Term Greenup County Court
Tuesday September 23d 1862

Ordered that an order of arrest issue against John C Adams late Presiding Judge of this Court returnable on to'morrow morning at 10 O'Clock A M to Shew cause why he Shall not be fined or imprisoned for a Contempt offered this Court for failing to produce and file a Statement of the indebtedness of Greenup County made out by George E Roe and Jeremiah Davidson Esqs Commissioners appointed by the Court for that purpose and the Sheriff will permit Said Adams to give bail in the Sum of One Hundred Dollars for his appearance at the time and place named

A Copy
Attest John S. Jones C. G. C. C.

Commonwealth
vs } order of arrest
John C. Adams
